Former FBI director James Comey indicted on charges of lying to Congress and obstruction
subhead: Comey is the first former official involved in one of Trump's grievances, the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election, to face prosecution. On Thursday, the ex-FBI director declared his innocence.

title: 'To frame Kirk's death as escalation misses the truth. The real threat is normalization'
subhead: British geographer Clionadh Raleigh examines the consequences of the assassination of the conservative influencer. By dismissing the fact that the man charged with this murder is a 'lone wolf' and accusing the left, the Trump administration is paving the way for more violence, she says.

title: Assata Shakur, fugitive Black liberation activist, dies in Cuba
subhead: A member of the Black Panther Party, Shakur escaped from a US prison in 1979, where she had been serving a life sentence for killing a police officer. She was given political asylum in Cuba.

title: Excerpt from the decision convicting Sarkozy: 'Acts of exceptional seriousness, likely to undermine citizens' trust'
subhead: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy was found guilty of criminal conspiracy in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign. Here is part of the court's decision.

subhead: Nicolas Sarkozy will become the first former president of the French Republic to sleep behind bars after being convicted of criminal conspiracy, in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign.

title: 'In Sudan, it is as if a congenital curse is at work. And the worst is yet to come'
subhead: Straddling the Arab world and Africa, this enduring military dictatorship has seen almost continuous armed conflict since gaining independence in 1956. Its neighbor, the young state of South Sudan, is suffering a similar tragedy, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Alexus Grynkewich, top NATO commander in Europe: 'Russia has always tried to maneuver for advantage over the alliance'
subhead: As the repercussions of the war in Ukraine increasingly impact Europe, NATO's new supreme allied commander Europe explains the measures aimed at countering any actions that target NATO member states.
byline: Chloé Hoorman,  Elise Vincent and  Philippe Jacqué
